github.name: get_commit
github.description: Get details for a commit from a GitHub repository

github.name: get_file_contents
github.description: Get the contents of a file or directory from a GitHub repository

github.name: get_label
github.description: Get a specific label from a repository.

github.name: get_latest_release
github.description: Get the latest release in a GitHub repository

github.name: get_me
github.description: Get details of the authenticated GitHub user. Use this when a request is about the user's own profile for GitHub. Or when information is missing to build other tool calls.

github.name: get_release_by_tag
github.description: Get a specific release by its tag name in a GitHub repository

github.name: get_tag
github.description: Get details about a specific git tag in a GitHub repository

github.name: get_team_members
github.description: Get member usernames of a specific team in an organization. Limited to organizations accessible with current credentials

github.name: get_teams
github.description: Get details of the teams the user is a member of. Limited to organizations accessible with current credentials

github.name: issue_read
github.description: Get information about a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

github.name: list_branches
github.description: List branches in a GitHub repository

github.name: list_commits
github.description: Get list of commits of a branch in a GitHub repository. Returns at least 30 results per page by default, but can return more if specified using the perPage parameter (up to 100).

github.name: list_issue_types
github.description: List supported issue types for repository owner (organization).

github.name: list_issues
github.description: List issues in a GitHub repository. For pagination, use the 'endCursor' from the previous response's 'pageInfo' in the 'after' parameter.

github.name: list_pull_requests
github.description: List pull requests in a GitHub repository. If the user specifies an author, then DO NOT use this tool and use the search_pull_requests tool instead.

github.name: list_releases
github.description: List releases in a GitHub repository

github.name: list_tags
github.description: List git tags in a GitHub repository

github.name: pull_request_read
github.description: Get information on a specific pull request in GitHub repository.

github.name: search_code
github.description: Fast and precise code search across ALL GitHub repositories using GitHub's native search engine. Best for finding exact symbols, functions, classes, or specific code patterns.

github.name: search_issues
github.description: Search for issues in GitHub repositories using issues search syntax already scoped to is:issue

github.name: search_pull_requests
github.description: Search for pull requests in GitHub repositories using issues search syntax already scoped to is:pr

github.name: search_repositories
github.description: Find GitHub repositories by name, description, readme, topics, or other metadata. Perfect for discovering projects, finding examples, or locating specific repositories across GitHub.

playwright.name: browser_close
playwright.description: Close the page

playwright.name: browser_resize
playwright.description: Resize the browser window

playwright.name: browser_console_messages
playwright.description: Returns all console messages

playwright.name: browser_handle_dialog
playwright.description: Handle a dialog

playwright.name: browser_evaluate
playwright.description: Evaluate JavaScript expression on page or element

playwright.name: browser_file_upload
playwright.description: Upload one or multiple files

playwright.name: browser_fill_form
playwright.description: Fill multiple form fields

playwright.name: browser_install
playwright.description: Install the browser specified in the config. Call this if you get an error about the browser not being installed.

playwright.name: browser_press_key
playwright.description: Press a key on the keyboard

playwright.name: browser_type
playwright.description: Type text into editable element

playwright.name: browser_navigate
playwright.description: Navigate to a URL

playwright.name: browser_navigate_back
playwright.description: Go back to the previous page in the history

playwright.name: browser_network_requests
playwright.description: Returns all network requests since loading the page

playwright.name: browser_run_code
playwright.description: Run Playwright code snippet

playwright.name: browser_take_screenshot
playwright.description: Take a screenshot of the current page. You can't perform actions based on the screenshot, use browser_snapshot for actions.

playwright.name: browser_snapshot
playwright.description: Capture accessibility snapshot of the current page, this is better than screenshot

playwright.name: browser_click
playwright.description: Perform click on a web page

playwright.name: browser_drag
playwright.description: Perform drag and drop between two elements

playwright.name: browser_hover
playwright.description: Hover over element on page

playwright.name: browser_select_option
playwright.description: Select an option in a dropdown

playwright.name: browser_tabs
playwright.description: List, create, close, or select a browser tab.

playwright.name: browser_wait_for
playwright.description: Wait for text to appear or disappear or a specified time to pass

safeoutputs.name: add_comment
safeoutputs.description: Add a comment to an existing GitHub issue, pull request, or discussion. Use this to provide feedback, answer questions, or add information to an existing conversation. For creating new items, use create_issue, create_discussion, or create_pull_request instead. IMPORTANT: Comments are subject to validation constraints enforced by the MCP server - maximum 65536 characters for the complete comment (including footer which is added automatically), 10 mentions (@username), and 50 links. Exceeding these limits will result in an immediate error with specific guidance. CONSTRAINTS: Maximum 1 comment(s) can be added.

safeoutputs.name: create_pull_request
safeoutputs.description: Create a new GitHub pull request to propose code changes. Use this after making file edits to submit them for review and merging. The PR will be created from the current branch with your committed changes. For code review comments on an existing PR, use create_pull_request_review_comment instead. CONSTRAINTS: Maximum 1 pull request(s) can be created. Title will be prefixed with "[docs] ". Labels [documentation automation] will be automatically added. PRs will be created as drafts. Reviewers [copilot] will be assigned.

safeoutputs.name: upload_asset
safeoutputs.description: Upload a file as a URL-addressable asset that can be referenced in issues, PRs, or comments. The file is stored on an orphaned git branch and returns a permanent URL. Use this for images, diagrams, or other files that need to be embedded in GitHub content. CONSTRAINTS: Maximum file size: 10240KB. Allowed file extensions: [.png .jpg .jpeg].

safeoutputs.name: missing_tool
safeoutputs.description: Report that a tool or capability needed to complete the task is not available, or share any information you deem important about missing functionality or limitations. Use this when you cannot accomplish what was requested because the required functionality is missing or access is restricted.

safeoutputs.name: missing_data
safeoutputs.description: Report that data or information needed to complete the task is not available. Use this when you cannot accomplish what was requested because required data, context, or information is missing.
